intro: Calathiana verna subsp. aestiva, commonly known as the early vernal calathiana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and thrives in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its small, white to pale pink flowers bloom in early spring, contributing to its ornamental value. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other members of the species.
